attributes.action: Make creative writing an A level subject again.
attributes.background:
Creative writing should be an A level subject as it is just as difficult as any others. For young people who want to become writers , their options at A level limit them.
Creative writing A level is fun and a way to get young people’s imaginations sparked in today’s society.

attributes.action: Student healthcare professionals to earn apprenticeship wage during placement.
attributes.background: Student healthcare professionals are under the equivalent pressure that all registered NHS professionals are, if not more as they have to cope with living costs, studying and handling all of the stress that the NHS has to offer at the age of 18+. This could be student paramedics, nurses, doctors etc
attributes.additional_details: Although students are not yet qualified they work just as hard and put in an immense amount of effort to gain their degree to practice. We take for granted the NHS and all those that work for it so let’s make a change and make it worthwhile and easier for those aspiring healthcare professionals.

attributes.action: Reinstate - Bring Back the Right of Appeal for UK Family Visit Visas
attributes.background: The basic Right of Appeal was brought in in 2000 for relatives wishing to visit their families in the United Kingdom whose visa applications were refused. That safety-net was suddenly abolished without proper consultation.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the then Government quietly and suddenly abolished that basic right of appeal and safety net for UK citizens whose relatives from time to time wishing to visit family in the United Kingdom. Since it was abolished, refusals have increased by two folds. Please help get this government to do the right thing and bring back this very basic of rights for immediate family members who in most cases are currently being refused without reason.

attributes.action: Give children under the age 18 the right to 10 days education free a year
attributes.background: I am a mother of a child recently starting the educational cycle, hoping for children's attendance to be the right of the parents, rather than the school having the final say in what our children can and cannot do. Hope I have opened people's eyes and can make a change.
attributes.additional_details: It is acceptable for a school to exclude a child for 2 weeks for bad behaviour, however it is not acceptable for parents to take a child on holiday for 7 days. These are our own children we are raising, It is a right of the parents to have the final say with attendance, with input from the educational side -  Not the other way around.  Please sign this petition and change the education system for families to better the lives of their children. Many endless thanks.

attributes.action: Britain should apologize for forced conscription in her West African colonies.
attributes.background: During WWII, Her Majesty’s Government forcefully conscripted young men from the former British West African colonies of the Gold Coast (now Ghana), Nigeria, Sierra Leone and the Gambia to fight against the Axis powers. It is estimated that the West African colonies supplied over 240,000 soldiers.
attributes.additional_details:
They experienced racial, and other forms, of discrimination compared to British soldiers. Tens of thousands of West African troops were killed in action or died of disease. Their families received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration. Many of those who survived returned home from the frontlines with combat-related Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration.
Please visit www.westafricaapology.com for further details.

attributes.action: The emergency SMS number 112 should be advertised on TV by the government.
attributes.background: The emergency SMS number 112 is a very useful alternative emergency services number to 999.  It is a number that also works across Europe and most countries worldwide. In training sessions for Basic Life Support it is clear that most people have never hear of its key properties.
attributes.additional_details: The properties of the emergency number 112 needs to be advertised by the UK government in a television information campaign on BBC. The advantages of 112 are that it is a GPS service.  People who are trying to contact emergency services do not need to know where they are as the 112 service can pin point their location.  Also, people can register their phone number to text an emergency message to 112.  This is crucial in areas where a phone signal is not possible.  The text will get through.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ask for someone’s previous salary.
attributes.background:
The salary negotiation process, and specifically the gender salary gap is directly affected by a company knowing a person’s previous salary. 

The salary band for the role should be defined for the role, and based on the responsibility and scope.

This shouldn’t be based on the previous salary.
attributes.additional_details: Previous salary should be treated like date of birth or age, gender, disability or trade union membership.

attributes.action: Reverse UK Sport decision not to fund badminton
attributes.background: UK Sport withdrew funding from Badminton for the next Olympics and restored approximately 10% of this funding back. In contrast around 30 million of funding was given to athletes for winter sports. We petition the government to restore funding to Badminton for the next Olympics.
attributes.additional_details: Badminton is the most popular indoor sports in the UK and is one of the few sports that can be played all year round in the UK. Winter sports is not a common sports in UK as the weather conditions and facilities are not conducive to it. It is limited in its availability to masses. If proper funding is available, badminton is much more likely to yield Olympics medals and also motivate the younger generation to participate in a sport that is readily available to them.

attributes.action: Establish a Public Service Production Company thats funded by the British public
attributes.background: Our film industry is currently a subsidiary of the US film industry. US Film Companies are incentivised by the Government to produce their films in the UK through tax rebates and breaks Instead of financially supporting the US industry the Government needs to financially support it's own
attributes.additional_details:
The petitions asks for the establishment of a publicly owned and funded film production company that produces films which serve a public interest. 

References http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-28213379 http://ask.ofcom.org.uk/help/television/what_is_psb http://www.newstatesman.com/culture/2015/03/we-dont-have-british-film-industry-business-film-takes-us-behind-movie-scenes

attributes.action: Make chain stores responsible for their plastic packaging, i.e extreme fines
attributes.background:
In every shop you visit how many items are packaged in plastic? 

We need to make chain companies responsible for their plastic input to our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Goverment fines: 
• Super Stores/Markets
• Retail Stores
• Warehouses
• Fast food chains
• Delivery companies 
• etc
For the amount of plastic packaging and waste they produce, the UK should see a decline in plastic packaging; in turn this could lessen the companies fines. With the money that it produces this could go towards companies who break down plastics to recycle them, or in to making any plastic waste in to materials to make roads, for example, instead of using asphalt.

attributes.action: Make local Authorities pay for injuries caused by neglect of public path/roads
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that local authorities pay compensation/vet fees for anyone/thing that is injuried due to them not maintaining public footpaths/roads/footbridges correctly.
attributes.additional_details: My dog had two claws ripped out from the root due to the local authorities neglect by not maintaining public footbridges correctly. The bridge had been covered by metal sheeting on top of rotten boards, over time and use the metal sheeting has come loose and moved resulting in my dogs claws becoming traped between levels resulting in two claws being ripped out. The local authority failed to compensate/pay vet fees even tho they carried out urgent repair work. Why should we and our pets suffer.

attributes.action: Make people with long-term medical conditions exempt from paying for medication
attributes.background: I am a young person suffering with a long term medical condition, there are many other people like me that need medication to prevent them from getting unwell. Due to medical exemption guidelines set out by the NHS Business Authority, we are having to pay £8.60 per prescription for key medications.
attributes.additional_details:
This feels immoral to me on the NHS Business Authorities' part as it is NOT MY FAULT that I have a long term medical condition as it was something I was born with. Yet, people like me are having to suffer financially when the UK has a National Health Service which is supposed to help people like me! 

Please help me in my fight for fairness! Please grant medical exemption for paying for prescriptions to people with long term medical conditions such as cardiac problems!

attributes.action: Ban the importation of animal fur into the UK
attributes.background: The UK government has already limited the importation of animal fur into the UK by Council Regulation (EEC) No 3254/91, however certain animal fur can still be imported, some from countries with poor animal welfare rights. The government should ban the importation of ALL animal fur into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
100 million+ animals are killed for their fur every year.
The Agreement on International Trapping Standards is aimed at the protection of the practice of trapping of wild animals for their fur with ‘humane’ standards. However, the trapping of wild animals for their fur can never be benign, the standards set in this agreement fall well below humane standards defined by veterinarian experts in the UK. Rather than extend the agreement, the government should ban the import of all fur into the UK.

attributes.action: Refund visa fees when rejected
attributes.background: We want the government to stop charging people for visas they do not receive. The current policy is to make the visa applicant pay for the visa upfront and then keep the money when the visa is refused. This is immoral, unjust and scandalous.
attributes.additional_details: My wife's visa was refused for financial reasons when I have earned £29,500 this year and the Home Office didn't believe it to be a genuine relationship when I have lived with her in Chile for 12 months and she has lived with me in the UK for 12 months. Considering the amount of money and time it takes to apply for a visa and the length of time an appeal will take the government should ask for further information if needed. The governments visa website is misleading and inaccurate.

attributes.action: All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future.
attributes.background: The recent BREXIT referendum limited the right of UK citizens to vote on the UK's future on the basis of residence. UK citizens, resident abroad, but still registered in electoral roles, were eligible. However, many others were disenfranchised and unable to vote on issues affecting their future.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens, working and living in the EU for more than 2 years before the Brexit referendum, were arbitrarily disenfranchised  by the UK Government, and were ineligible to vote on an issue that affected their future and legal standing in the EU. Parliament must ensure that any future referendum affecting the governance of the UK must consult all UK citizens, regardless of residence. Local Consular offices charged with registering all UK citizens abroad, can verify their voting eligibility.

attributes.action: Ban the sale, manufacture or distribution of plastic confetti in the UK.
attributes.background: Plastic confetti is still used at weddings and parties despite it being a dramatic example of littering non-biodegradable materials.  Confetti is designed to be small and light to 'float' when thrown and therefore it is very hard to pick up and will spread widely in the wind. It has to go!
attributes.additional_details: Today I saw Branscombe Beach on Devon covered in silver and gold confetti.  There was so much it was impossible to collect it all and it was very hard to pick up as it was so thin and small.  This kind of littering has to stop and individuals celebrating need to be prevented from making environmentally damaging choices such as this. When so many other options are available,  plastic confetti needs up be banned.

attributes.action: Open a coroner's inquest for every stillborn baby.
attributes.background: In 2011 a midwife signed by baby off to receive a stillborn certificate. 7 years I have fought and in March this year the coroner found that my baby was NOT stillborn. He survived for 1hr10minutes, he suffered a neonatal death and should have received a Birth and Death certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
How many more families have/are going through this? How many babies could there be that have been wrongfully categorised as Stillborn?
We need to change the law so that every single baby who the midwives/doctors believe to be stillborn receives a coroner's inquest. If this was the case back in 2011 it would have saved our family 7 years of heartache. 
Now our son's birth will be registered and he will forever be on our family tree, he will never be forgotten, what every baby deserves.

attributes.action: Cap the price of UK train fares so they are in line with other major economies
attributes.background: I ask the government to consider taking action against the astronomical train fares facing the British public. We pay significantly more than other major global economies. The train should be a cheaper alternative to driving for the sake of the environment and the future of the planet/mankind.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The Independent we spend "six times more on fares than peers in Europe with 14% of our income being spent on monthly season tickets...significantly higher than the 2% seen in France, 3% in Germany and 4% in Spain."

Fullfact.org says "the cost of an annual season ticket covering long-distance travel can exceed £3000, the equivalent of over £1000 more than the next dearest country: the Netherlands. "

attributes.action: Allow all people with vitamin D deficiency to receive free prescriptions.
attributes.background: A large section of the population will be affected due to the lack of sunshine and genetic make up. Vitamin D acts like a hormone and every cell in the body has a receptor for it, without it there are many symptoms and conditions that can occur.
attributes.additional_details: There are many conditions and symptoms of being Vitamin D deficient. Those with more melanin are at an instant disadvantage living in the UK. In order for these individuals to maintain their health, they have to bear the brunt of the cost and if they are to remain in the UK, this will be an expediture for thier lifetime. If a persons genetic make up renders them more vulnerable and this genetic make up exists within large sectors of the public, surely this should be handled as a social issue.

attributes.action: Make it law that it is reported to the police when a cat is knocked down.
attributes.background: Unlike the current laws regarding dogs, it is NOT required to report the knocking down of a cat. Not only is it unfair, but also cruel. A cat has as much right as a dog, however, they are not given the same kindness and protection of the current laws of our lands.

attributes.action: Bring back the convalescent homes in the UK
attributes.background: The A&E departments are oversubscribed because there are insufficient beds in the hospital's due to the lack of care providers for discharged patients . This deficit in care provision is because the care sector is underpaid especially because of pay and conditions. We need convalescent homes back.
attributes.additional_details: The rural areas have a lack of home care provision brought about by low wage levels and pay conditions which deny payments for travel time and mileage. This means that the rural areas are not easily served. Hence these care providers have a high turnover of staff. For the majority of single elderly, a return home after major surgery is one with no care. Convalescent homes would allow a low level of staffing serving more patients.  Benefits to patients is safety, peer competition & high morale.

attributes.action: Reinstate Part 2 of the Leveson Inquiry
attributes.background: The Government has cancelled the second part of the Leveson Inquiry into the scale of potentially unlawful behaviour by the Press and Police during the phone hacking scandal.
attributes.additional_details: The public deserves to know of any collaboration involved and any identified offenders should be brought to justice.

attributes.action: Govt take action to protect UK citizens in Kerala regarding elephant parades
attributes.background: Every year UK citizens visit Kerala to watch religious ceremonies exploiting captive elephants. The elephants are subjected to the most horrific cruelties in order to control them. The ceremonies always take place during musth season so the elephants are regularly running amock and harming people.
attributes.additional_details: It's important the Govt informs UK citizens of high risk of danger to human lives.

attributes.action: Strip the £32m funding from Oxfam & share to the rest of the charities in the UK
attributes.background: There is 185000 Charities registered in the UK and the vast the majority rely on meagre amounts compared to this £32m to teach Oxfam a lesson who already make £90m a year from it's shops, this could significantly help the smaller independent charities up and down the entire country
attributes.additional_details: There are more than 185,000 registered charities in England and Wales. The number is rising by 5,000 a year. As you read this, another charity will be created somewhere in the country. The charity commission lists 620 cancer charities alone and more than 200 charities working with homeless people just in London. - The Guardian

attributes.action: Fine MPs for the non-disclosure of outside earnings and benefits
attributes.background: Following the 30-day suspension of an MP for the non-disclosure of two luxury holidays valued at up to £100,000, the House of Commons should change its rules to allow MPs to be fined half the value of everything they fail to properly disclose. This would improve compliance and public trust.

attributes.action: An additional £350 million/week must go to the NHS or hold a second referendum
attributes.background: The UK was made to believe that an additional £350 million per week would go to the NHS due to savings directly caused by leaving the EU. If this does not happen the country was lied to by politicians & the vote is therefore invalid. A second Brexit referendum must be held based on detailed facts.

attributes.action: Make 30 hours free child care available to all working parents including non-EU
attributes.background:
The conservative government introduced the 30 hours free child care to all working parents in 2016. This was a very welcomed news as it will help greatly with childcare costs.

I was greatly shocked to realise that we were NOT eligible for the 30hrs because of our immigration status(outside EEA).
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and my husband have been residents in this country for 9 years and we are both working, paying our taxes and NI. We are not entitled to public funds including child tax credit or child benefit.

It is UNFAIR that we get taxed as other working parents/ persons but we are denied the 30 hours free child care. This is harsh, unjust, unacceptable and discriminately. 


https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-brings-forward-plans-to-double-free-childcare-for-working-families

attributes.action: Stop animals being given away as prizes or sold at funfairs.
attributes.background: Carnival fish are often kept in poor conditions in small bags. These bags become very hot on warm days and will run out of oxygen. They're given without any advice on how to care for them. Goldfish live on average 5-10 years in captivity however carnival fish often die shortly after being given.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for 14-16 year olds to learn working life skills in school
attributes.background: It should be a compulsory part of the national curruculum for all students between the ages of 14-16 to be taught how to create a basic household budget,how to apply for job vacancies,how to conduct themselves at interviews,how to keep documentation of job's they have applied for.
attributes.additional_details: Stated above are fundamental subjects that should be covered within the national curriculum,as they are crucial life skills that will prepare our young people for a sturdy working life. As a parent of a school leaver i am teaching my child these things,i have a huge interest in my child's past and future education,however not all parents are equipped with the knowledge to teach life skills to their children,so i believe making it a compulsory subject in schools is the best way forward.

attributes.action: Allow individuals with  Coeliac Disease to join the British Armed Forces
attributes.background: Currently you cannot join any British Armed Forces with Coeliac Disease as it may affect operational ability. Vegetarian/ Halal diets are provided- but no GF. Coeliacs can be asymptomatic and with a GF diet would be an asset to the Armed Forces. Refusal to supply a Gluten Free diet is discriminatory
attributes.additional_details:
The Israeli Army has started supplying Gluten Free diets to it's soldiers proving it possible.Refusal to provide a GF catering option in the UK  Forces is discriminatory. Coeliac sufferers  should be assessed on an individual basis when applying to enlist. There is an undisclosed number of serving personnel,diagnosed following enlistment - some required early discharge 
/ medical downgrading - but many who continue active service. Exact numbers unknown as previous FOI requests were rejected

attributes.action: Create a fairer child maintenance payment for all
attributes.background: Child maintenance is calculated on Gross Pay, rather than Net income. What you are paid and what you take home are very different amounts. Based on Gross, you pay far more child maintenance than you can afford.
attributes.additional_details: Paying on your net pay (what you actually see in your bank account) would mean you pay a fair amount of child maintenance. Not a hugely inflated figure, but a right and just amount.

attributes.action: Cancel the franchise for Great Western Railways
attributes.background:
Continuous delays, overcrowding on the new trains with carriages locked to customers due to lack of staff, poor announcements to inform of delays. Lack of empathy to customers. 
Total disregard to season ticket holders with little or no compensation available.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to carry pillion passengers on a moped.
attributes.background: Let's put a stop to rising criminal offences including acid attacks, mobile phone theft, handbag theft and other crimes aided by mopeds which are far easier to carry out when carrying pillion passengers. Motorbikes over 50cc to be exempt.

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget by 50% and use this money to save the NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis and needs urgent investment. This money would allow for more facilities to be built, more training and recruitment of doctors and nurses, more research and extra mental health provisions. Also, as people are living longer the NHS needs more facilities to help the elderly.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple reports from healthcare experts, RCN, news reports etc all point to our NHS being at breaking point.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic film wrappers that are not biodegradable.
attributes.background: Many plastic film wrappers such as those used when mailing magazines, are not biodegradable. Yet materials that could replace such wrappers are readily available. The existing wrappers cause, at the very least, an eye-sore when blown around our countryside. At the extreme they kill wild creatures.

attributes.action: New law so that mobile suppliers cannot change the terms of contracts
attributes.background: I believe contracts should be honoured. As a consumer I do not have the right to change the terms of the contract after a purchase. I want a new law to state that mobile phone companies cannot change the terms of a contract without the consent of the other party to the contract.
attributes.additional_details: In March, I renewed my SIM-only contract because it offered free roaming in Turkey at no additional cost. Within a few weeks they contacted me to say that free roaming in Turkey is no longer included in my contract and would cost £6 a day to use my phone there. My wife also took out a contract a couple of weeks after me with the same belief that we could use our phones in Turkey for no fee.

attributes.action: Make banks directly responsible for contacting those who have been missold PPI
attributes.background: Banks and credit card companies place the onus on individuals to seek out whether they have had PPI, yet they hold this information and it is readily available to them.  The responsibility should rest with the companies who have missold to make all efforts to trace their victims and make recompense.
attributes.additional_details: Banks hold the information in their systems and files as to who had PPI.  Those most likely to need the compensation are possibly least able to pursue a claim.  Why should individuals have to possibly employ companies who gain financially from their loss or try to remember historical financial contracts?  Now the government has put a deadline for claiming.  Before that deadline banks should make every reasonable effort to trace those who have had PPI making it easier for them to pursue a claim.

attributes.action: The immigration amnesty of Grenfell survivors should be indefinitely extended
attributes.background: ‘Foreign’ survivors of the Grenfell Tower fire were granted a temporary 12-month immigration “amnesty” for them to stay in the U.K. regardless of their immigration status but may still face deportation after that.

attributes.action: Investigate the links between MPs and foreign intelligence services
attributes.background: In our age of democracy it is important that all our representatives in Parliament do not act in a way that can be seen to be against parliamentary and democratic standards.

attributes.action: Mandatory invisible disability signs to be displayed in highly populated areas
attributes.background: my son is 5 yrs old, non verbal autistic, who's behaviour can be hard and unpredictable at times, especially on public transport where we have had to explain his behaviour and rude comments made about him. physical disabilities don't have to be explained so why should invisible ones?
attributes.additional_details:
hidden and mental disabilities should be recognised equal to those with physical disabilities. no one should have to justify their actions because of their disability. signs should be put in restaurants, on public transport, in schools and play parks etc and any other public places with large volumes of people ...
stop people thinking children with additional needs are naughty by raising awareness.

attributes.action: Mandatory right for substance misuse clients to have an independent advocate
attributes.background: We want it to be a statutory right for people with substance misuse issues to have access to an independent advocate, like other types of patients in the Mental Health Act 2010. We feel this will allow dual diagnosis clients who can't access mental health services better access to support networks.
attributes.additional_details:
50% of people with severe mental health issues have substance misuse issues.
37% of alcohol abusers have a mental health issue.
53% of drug users also have mental health issues.
These people cant access independent advocates through the mental health act because mental health services want these people to deal with their addictions before they commence treatment for mental health.

Figures from Helpguide.org

attributes.action: Make sanitary products free for all women
attributes.background: Why should women pay for a something they can't control?
attributes.additional_details: There are women and children missing days at school and work coz they can't afford products to keep them clean.

attributes.action: Increase fines for leaving animals in cars
attributes.background: Increase fines to £5000 and be banned from keeping dogs for life

attributes.action: Make changes to make the theft of a dog a specific offence.
attributes.background: Dog theft is on the increase. A dog is not an object like the law considers them at the moment, the same as the treatment is different to how you would treat an object. The law needs to change in order to curb the increase in dog theft and the misery it brings to many.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics suggest that 60 dogs are stolen every week. That's 60 to many.

attributes.action: Amend the PPERA 2000 to ban all foreign donations at all times
attributes.background:
The UK currently allows foreigners to donate to political causes and campaigns. The PPERA allows this outside of election campaigns, which gives foreign money undue influence in United kingdom political life.

The PPERA 2000 should be amended to ban all such at all times

attributes.action: Remove GDPR from UK law as soon as we leave the EU in March 2019.
attributes.background: GDPR has probably been the worst piece of red tape to come out of the EU, its extremely costly to businesses, mainly to small businesses who don’t have massive legal departments and staff in place to swallow up the regulation. GDPR is also extremely damaging to our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK voted to leave the EU 2 years ago and we are still having to put up with the ridiculously damaging and annoying regulations. It is believed that the cost of GDPR to UK businesses has already run into the billions, with many small business not at all geared up to deal with it.

attributes.action: Raise the definition of a child in the Mental Health Act to from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Parents of 16 year old children held under the Mental Health Act cannot find out how they’re coping. The staff are unable to share any information on the children. Children under 18 are unable to keep themselves safe, so 16 to 18 year olds should be classified as children under the Act.

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Make ADHD part of the blue badge scheme
attributes.background: Autism and physical disabilities are included in the blue badge scheme but people don’t understand how hard it is to catch public transport and make your journey with an ADHD child!! When they have a set routine and you miss your bus ADHD is just a challenge as any other disability.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if ADHD children got accepted for a blue badge it would help a lot of families . Like less melt downs, less late trips or making shopping easier. Nothing is worse than having errands to do and your child is kicking off because you are 10 minutes late home and they have a certain routine.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of pencil sharpeners with easy release blades.
attributes.background: Many young adults these days with the pressures of school, friends and social media struggle at times and sadly turn to self-harm. As a parent you can hide all the sharp cutting items in your house only to find your child using the removable blade from a pencil sharpener.
attributes.additional_details: How is that an under 18 can’t go and buy a knife, razor or anything with a blade but can go and buy a pencil sharpener which has a removable blade? There’s even a video on YouTube that shows you how to remove it although it is only a tiny screw holding it in so it’s not rocket science! To ban all under 18s buying one is not perceivable but I do believe they could be manufactured differently such as having a non-tamper screw. If the Government bans those where the blade is easy to release, industry will follow with a safer product. Something has to be done.
